intro: Cyanothamnus tenuis, commonly known as the slender bluebush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat. Cyanothamnus tenuis is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
